page.title: 11Religion in Mabe
page.content: In{Mabe}we have a{Church}of{England} which is called{St Laudus}after the saint. The Church is a long way out of the village because it was there to serve the Parish of{Treverva}as well. Opposite the church there is the old vicarage which has been sold and is now privately owned. The vicar lives in a new vicarage which is a bungalow in the village.There is also a{Methodist {Church}which is almost at the top of Antron Hill. There is no{Manse}in the village as there is no resident Minister and the services are taken by a visiting{Minister.}
